commit.message: Added error handling for no .pyc files

Add support for Python 3.7 (#47)

Original patch by Miro Hrončok. See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi\?id\=1605884
Dropped PyYAML dev dependency to fix GitHub vulnerability warning
Dropped Python 3.3 as issue is in flake8 it seems
Upgraded flake8 and flake8-quotes to fix Travis CI
Updated test to verify only 1 error is caught and dropped redundant test
Updated parameter to paths instead of filepaths

Updated recursion method and added better tests.

Changed the traversal method to `os.walk()` method.
Also, added tests for checking invalid files in folders and also in subfolders.

Added option of supplying directory to rst-lint.

This commit adds the feature of supplying a directory to rst-lint.
The program *recurses*  (so all the files within subdirectories would also be traversed) to find all the `.rst`
files in the directory, and lints the files.

Closes https://github.com/twolfson/restructuredtext-lint/issues/38
Moved to foundry-release-pypi@3.0.0 for twine-based releases

Fix syntax highlighting in README (#44)

```console
$ pygmentize -L | grep -A1 -E '^[*] (bash|console),'
* bash, sh, ksh, zsh, shell:
    Bash (filenames *.sh, *.ksh, *.bash, *.ebuild, *.eclass, *.exheres-0, *.exlib, *.zsh, .bashrc, bashrc, .bash_*, bash_*, zshrc, .zshrc, PKGBUILD)
--
* console, shell-session:
    Bash Session (filenames *.sh-session, *.shell-session)
```
You want the latter lexer.
Replaced Gittip with support me page
Removed pypy3 from Travis CI to fix issues
